name: Soulgazer Intensifying Waterproof Gel Eyeliner
about: What it is:¬†A clean, waterproof, retractable gel eyeliner powered by hyaluronic acid for the smoothest glide and easiest application in eye-intensifying colors...Benefits:¬†Long-wearing, Waterproof.Highlighted Ingredients:¬†- Hyaluronic Acid: Locks in hydration for a smooth glide...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also vegan, gluten-free, and cruelty-free...What Else You Need to Know: This unique, creamy, waterproof gel eyeliner has quick playtime and blendability before it locks into place. The everyday basics-but-better shades across matte and satin finishes are designed to amplify your eye color for soul-piercing eyes that pop. The retractable pencil also has a built-in sharpener and smudger for any look...Clinical Results: Based on a consumer-perception study of 32 women, after 8 hours of wearing Soulgazer:.- 100% agreed it is super easy to use, glides on smoothly, and applies evenly.- 97% agreed it delivers rich color payoff and stays color true/does not fade.- 94% agreed it is the best eyeliner they have ever tried and would replace their current eyeliner
ingredients: -Hyaluronic Acid: Locks in hydration for a smooth glide...Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Synthetic Wax, Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, Hydrogenated Poly(C6-14 Olefin), Hydrogenated Polydecene, Mica, Silica Silylate, Polybutene, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ethylhexyl Palmitate, Copernicia Cerifera (Carnauba) Wax/Cire De Carnauba, Trihydroxystearin, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Ethylene/Propylene Copolymer, Kaolin, Silica, Phenoxyethanol [+/-: CI 77007 (Ultramarines), CI 77491 (Iron Oxide), CI 77742 (Manganese Violet), CI 77891 (Titanium Dioxide).
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Wear it how you feel it: sharply precise or purposefully smudgy. .-Use the built-in sharpener and attached smudge tool to get your desired look. .-After use, press the cap tightly to preserve the formula‚Äôs creaminess.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: K guys, hear me out ! I purchased this from Kosas because Sephora was out of the Bewitched shade. I also purchased Hypnotize (matte black). I'm really glad I did and here are a few reasons why: 1. ) I went to Sephora to swatch these and compared them to MUF & UD. The MUF ones literally would not come off my hand and the Kosas ones did once I used m/u remover. I am not someone who wants to sleep in my eyeliner so took this to be a good sign.  2.) I have oily skin - lt's combo for part of the month and oily oily for the second half. I WAS ABLE TO USE THIS WITHOUT AN EYESHADOW UNDER IT. That means it did not transfer to my upper lids throughout a normal 8 hour work day. This is true for both colors. It also of course works with a powder eyeshadow. I was impressed by the long-wearing feature and I'm assuming that's why this product leans a bit dry.  3.) This is not that squishy gooey style of eyeliner that will work in your water line aka kohl. It works on the lash line and the matte formula is smoother so will work for some people's waterline. The satin formula not so much, which I think is completely fine if you're not using it for that. I don't think that makes it a bad product. It's a 'clean' make up item which means there are going to be variations in formula and capability.  4.) I think the colors are super unique. I compared them to MUF and UD in-store and found them to be original and flattering.  Overall I absolutely think this eyeliner is worth purchasing, if you get one that is crumbly or breaks its probably a bad batch. I ordered mine direct from Kosas and did not have this issue.  Source- Mid 30's, make up nerd, I don't watch tik-tok.

reviews.review_title: Glides on Easily on Aging Skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received this product for free from Kosas and Influenster in exchange for my honest review.   The Kosas Soul Gazer Intensifying Gel Eyeliner has been a game-changer for me. As someone with aging skin, finding an eyeliner that glides on effortlessly and helps me achieve a natural everyday look has been a challenge. However, this gel eyeliner has exceeded my expectations.  The formula is incredibly smooth and creamy, allowing it to effortlessly glide on my eyelids without any tugging or pulling. This makes the application process much easier and more enjoyable. The pigmentation is also impressive, providing a rich and intense color payoff that lasts throughout the day.  What I appreciate the most about this eyeliner is its ability to enhance my eyes while still looking natural. The gel formula allows me to create precise lines that define my eyes without looking too harsh or overdone. It effortlessly blends with my eyeshadow and complements my overall makeup look.  Additionally, the Soul Gazer Intensifying Gel Eyeliner is long-lasting and does not smudge or fade throughout the day. It stays put, even on my aging skin, which tends to be more prone to creasing and smudging. I can confidently wear it all day without worrying about touch-ups or smudges.  Overall, I am thoroughly impressed with the Kosas Soul Gazer Intensifying Gel Eyeliner. It has become an essential part of my everyday makeup routine, helping me achieve a natural and effortless look. If you're looking for an eyeliner that is easy to glide on and works well on aging skin, I highly recommend giving this product a try.
